alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 12:59PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Teller and northwestern El Paso Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1259 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gleneagle, or 16 miles north of Colorado Springs, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Colorado Springs, Monument, Air Force Academy, Palmer Lake, Black Forest, Peyton, Gleneagle, Schriever AFB, Falcon and Cimarron Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
